intro: Pagiantha mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius pagiantha, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
